value value
Returns:

int tmrm_hash_from_string ( tmrm_hash *  hash,
const char *  string 
)

Initialise a hash from a string.

The string format is something like: key1='value1',key2='value2', key3='\'quoted value\''

The 's are required and whitespace can appear around the = and ,s

Parameters:
hash hash object
string hash encoded as a string
Returns:
non 0 on failure.

char* tmrm_hash_get ( tmrm_hash *  hash,
const char *  key 
)

Retrieve one value from hash for a given key as string.

The value returned is from newly allocated memory which the caller must free.

Parameters:
hash hash object
key pointer to key
Returns:
Returns the value or NULL on failure

tmrm_iterator* tmrm_hash_get_all ( tmrm_hash *  hash,
tmrm_hash_datum *  key,
tmrm_hash_datum *  value 
)

Retrieve all values from hash for a given key.

The iterator returns tmrm_hash_datum objects containing the values. These are newly allocated memory which the caller must free.

Parameters:
hash Hash object
key Pointer to key
value Pointer to value
Returns:
a tmrm_iterator serialization of all values or NULL on failure

int tmrm_hash_get_as_boolean ( tmrm_hash *  hash,
const char *  key 
)

Lookup a hash key and decode value as a boolean.

Parameters:
hash tmrm_hash object
key key string to look up
Returns:
>0 (for true), 0 (for false) or <0 (for key not found or not known boolean value)

long tmrm_hash_get_as_long ( tmrm_hash *  hash,
const char *  key 
)

Lookup a hash key and decode value as a long.

Parameters:
hash tmrm_hash object
key key string to look up
Returns:
>0 (for success), <0 (for key not found or not known boolean value)

char* tmrm_hash_get_del ( tmrm_hash *  hash,
const char *  key 
)

Retrieve one value from hash for a given key as string and remove all values with that key.

The value returned is from newly allocated memory which the caller must free.

Parameters:
hash Hash object
key Pointer to key
Returns:
the value or NULL on failure

int tmrm_hash_get_fd ( tmrm_hash *  hash  ) 

Get the file descriptor for the hash.

This returns the file descriptor if it is file based for use with file locking.

Returns:
the file descriptor

int tmrm_hash_open ( tmrm_hash *  hash,
const char *  identifier,
int  mode,
int  is_writable,
int  is_new,
tmrm_hash *  options 
)

Start a hash association.

This method opens and/or creates a new hash with any resources it needs.

Parameters:
hash Hash object
identifier Identifier for the hash factory - usually a URI or file name
mode hash access mode
is_writable is hash writable?
is_new is hash new?
options a hash of options for the hash factory or NULL if there are none.
Returns:
Non 0 on failure

FILE *  fh 
)

int tmrm_hash_put ( tmrm_hash *  hash,
tmrm_hash_datum *  key,
tmrm_hash_datum *  value 
)

Insert key/value pairs into the hash according to flags.

The key and values are copied into the hash; the original pointers can be deleted.

Parameters:
hash Hash object
key key
value value
Returns:
non 0 on failure

int tmrm_hash_put_strings ( tmrm_hash *  hash,
const char *  key,
const char *  value 
)

Insert key/value pairs into the hash as strings.

The key and values are copied into the hash, no sharing is done.

Parameters:
hash hash object
key key
value value
Returns:
non 0 on failure

const char *  name,
void(*)(tmrm_hash_factory *)  factory 
)

tmrm_hash_register_factory:

Parameters:
sms Subject map sphere object

factory pointer to function to call to register the factory
Register a hash factory.

Get the number of values in the hash.

Parameters:

Returns:

void tmrm_init_hash ( tmrm_subject_map_sphere *  sms  ) 

Initialises and registers all compiled hash modules.

Must be called before using any of the hash factory functions such as tmrm_get_hash_factory()

INTERNAL - Initialise the hash module.

Parameters:
sms subject map sphere object
